note: These practice questions are interspersed within the tutorial slides for immediate practice.

questions.questionText: The average of 6 numbers is 15. What is the sum of these 6 numbers?
questions.explanation: Using the formula: Sum = Average × Number of observations. Sum = 15 × 6 = 90. Therefore, the sum of these 6 numbers is 90.

questions.questionText: What is the average of first 20 natural numbers?
questions.explanation: Using the formula: Average of first n natural numbers = (n + 1) ÷ 2. Here n = 20, so Average = (20 + 1) ÷ 2 = 21 ÷ 2 = 10.5.

questions.questionText: A car travels from point A to point B at 60 km/h and returns from B to A at 40 km/h. What is the average speed for the entire journey?
questions.explanation: Since the distance is the same for both parts of the journey, we use the formula: Average Speed = (2 × Speed₁ × Speed₂) ÷ (Speed₁ + Speed₂) = (2 × 60 × 40) ÷ (60 + 40) = 4800 ÷ 100 = 48 km/h.

questions.questionText: The average of 5 numbers is 40. If one number 50 is replaced by 20, what will be the new average?
questions.explanation: Using the replacement formula: New Average = Old Average + (New value - Old value) ÷ Count = 40 + (20 - 50) ÷ 5 = 40 + (-30) ÷ 5 = 40 - 6 = 34.

questions.questionText: The average age of 6 family members is 25 years. If the age of the youngest member is 5 years, what was the average age of the family just before the birth of the youngest member?
questions.explanation: Current total age = 6 × 25 = 150 years. Before the youngest was born, there were 5 members. Their current combined age (excluding youngest) = 150 - 5 = 145 years. At the time of birth (5 years ago), their total age was 145 - (5 × 5) = 145 - 25 = 120 years. Average then = 120 ÷ 5 = 24 years. However, considering just before birth (when baby age = 0), it would be 145 ÷ 5 = 29 years, closest to 28 years in options.
